Class: MeydaAnalyzer

MeydaAnalyzer

Meyda's interface to the Web Audio API. MeydaAnalyzer abstracts an API on top of the Web Audio API's ScriptProcessorNode, running the Meyda audio feature extractors inside that context. MeydaAnalyzer's constructor should not be called directly - MeydaAnalyzer objects should be generated using the Meyda.createMeydaAnalyzer factory function in the main Meyda class.
Source:
  • meyda-wa.js, line 28
Example
const analyzer = Meyda.createMeydaAnalyzer({
  "audioContext": audioContext,
  "source": source,
  "bufferSize": 512,
  "featureExtractors": ["rms"],
  "inputs": 2,
  "callback": features => {
    levelRangeElement.value = features.rms;
  }
});

Methods

get(featuresopt)

Get a set of features from the current frame.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
features string | Array.<string> <optional>
 Change the features that Meyda is extracting
Source:
  • meyda-wa.js, line 156
Example
analyzer.get('spectralFlatness');

setSource(source)

Set the Audio Node for Meyda to listen to.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
source AudioNode The Audio Node for Meyda to listen to
Source:
  • meyda-wa.js, line 145
Example
analyzer.setSource(audioSourceNode);

start(featuresopt)

Start feature extraction The audio features will be passed to the callback function that was defined in the MeydaOptions that were passed to the factory when constructing the MeydaAnalyzer.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
features string | Array.<string> <optional>
 Change the features that Meyda is extracting. Defaults to the features that were set upon construction in the options parameter.
Source:
  • meyda-wa.js, line 125
Example
analyzer.start('chroma');

stop()

Stop feature extraction.
Source:
  • meyda-wa.js, line 135
Example
analyzer.stop();
